It’s also very waterproof and you can see the water bead off of him.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: We love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this sunscreen. It doesn’t have harsh chemicals and keeps my child’s skin safe. I apply it frequently while being outside and/or make sure there’s a decent layer. Never have issues with sun burns so far. It’s pretty easy to apply, even though takes more time than spray. Yes, it may make skin white, but it doesn’t bother me or my child so far.
customer_reviews.author: Yulia

customer_reviews.title: Relatively easy to apply and works great
customer_reviews.text: I give this 5 stars for sun protection. We had a picnic at 9000' in blazing sun and my son's bare legs were fine. I thin it rubs in relatively well for being a zinc formula. I like that it's non-nano, very important to me when researching sunscreens. It is scented but I think the scent is light.
customer_reviews.author: J. Freyberg

customer_reviews.title: Best sunscreen for my son
customer_reviews.text: This one spreads a lot easier than Baby Aveeno and smells nicer too. Baby Aveeno is a good brand, I'm still using their shampoo and lotions. Their sunscreen was not bad but this one is better. My parents like it too. They always apply it together with my son before they go out and take a walk. Will purchase a second one soon.
customer_reviews.author: dxxw

customer_reviews.title: Finally a sunscreen to love!
customer_reviews.text: I'm always looking for good sunscreen especially for the kids. This one is definitely is one of my favorites. Easy to apply, smell is pleasant (mild coconut), ewg approved ingredients, doesn't irritate sensitive skin, reef safe, seems to protect fairly well although not as water resistant as my stick style sunscreens so needs to be reapplied often. A bit on the pricey side but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter's Mama

customer_reviews.title: Review for *DARKER* Skin Tones
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to spread and didn't irritate the skin Cons: Little to no protection. After 1 hour skin was significantly darker. On me, it left a light iridescent color that wasn't very noticeable. However, if you are darker than a brown paper bag, it leaves an odd purple tint on the skin. (Think Disney's Vampirina). After 30 minutes, it settles into a chalky, matte finish. I would put up with the weird tint if it ACTUALLY blocked the sun. WILL NOT repurchase or recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Great Sunscreen!
customer_reviews.text: Was very effective for 3 full days at Disneyland and another day at the beach. A little goes a LONG way (I was afraid the 3oz bottle would not be big enough for both my daughter and me but we had plenty left over at the end of our trip), it applies smoothly, doesn’t stain clothing, and has a really good, light scent. I have sensitive skin/allergy issues and also burn very easily but can report that I didn’t see any negative side effects from using this sunscreen.
customer_reviews.author: Utefan

customer_reviews.title: ... started using this 2 year ago and it's been great. I love the smell of it
customer_reviews.text: I started using this 2 year ago and it's been great. I love the smell of it. I haven't had any issues with it since using it - my toddler hasn't had a sunburn (knock on wood). I even use it on myself sometimes because I really like the smell and goes on non greasy. My niece was breaking out after using the more popular brands you can find at the grocery store and I put this on her and her skin didn't react to this product.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Judy Judy

customer_reviews.title: Gentle, no sunburns!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great! Contains none of the yucky chemicals of regular sunscreens (passes Whole Foods premium care requirements). It’s not stinky, sticky, or greasy, and rubs in easily. I use this on my 6-month-old, 3-year-old, and myself (spf 50) and none of us have had a burn or irritated skin. We haven’t applied it too close to the eyes but haven’t had any issues with it running into and stinging our eyes. Is water-resistant to 80 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: EmzGemz

customer_reviews.title: By the end of the trip my son developed a bad "heat" rash (or what i thought it was at ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this prior to a trip to Florida. By the end of the trip my son developed a bad "heat" rash (or what i thought it was at the time). After returning home we had a period of hot weather and after several days at that beach/pool using this product he also developed another "heat" rash. He is 5 and has never had these types of rashes before. I have discontinued using this product at the beginning of July and his rash has not returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What not to do
customer_reviews.text: This product is reliable for preventing sunburn if applied correctly. I do not advise asking your 5 year old kid to apply it to your back when you know you will be at the beach at high noon for 4 hours and you just stepped off a plane from Seattle and your snow-white skin hadn't seen the light of day for the past 9 months. Your back will look like strawberry swirl cheesecake. Unbearable pain for days.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Arrived almost expired
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived with an expiration date within 3 months and no way to exchange or return it. I am willing to pay the high price for the clean, high quality ingredients but need it to list more than 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Good but greasy.
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit that I hate all sunscreens because it's hard to find the perfect one for kids, but obviously it's more important that it does the job. (They're either too thick or too greasy or hard to spread.) This one seems to work and I read a lot of good reviews but I will say this...try to keep it away from your kid's hair. It's easy to get out of the hair but it makes the hair greasy.
customer_reviews.author: S&M

customer_reviews.title: Best natural sunscreen ever.
customer_reviews.text: Best natural sunscreen ever. I've tried dozens. This one easily rubs in. Doesn't stay white. Smells good. WORKS. I have used it on my toddler for two years and I love it so much I started using it for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Only sunscreen I will purchase for my toddler
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sunscreen for my toddler. The scent is pleasant, the texture/consistency is good (not too thick, not greasy, easy to rub in), and best of all: does the job of keeping my son safe in the sun while I can rest easy that the ingredients are good for my son and for the environment. Nothing more needs to be said!
customer_reviews.author: T KarcherTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: No issues and have been using it for the last 4 - 5 years
customer_reviews.text: This is the non-toxic sunscreen that I have liked best. It does work for us, no issues with sunburns or reactions. I have been buying this for the past 4-5 years now, have try many other non-toxic or less toxic brands, and this is the one I would buy again and again.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorites...
customer_reviews.text: Thinkbaby is my regular go-to for sunscreen. It has great ratings on ewg and it works well. If you are used to "regular" sunscreen, yes, it is thicker and more annoying to rub in. But in comparison to many other natural sunscreens, this one is better. A little goes a long way, so it does last. I've been using this brand for several years now and have not been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I think one of the biggest deterrents for this is the price - but honestly, it's not that much more than a drugstore brand and you KNOW it is better quality. I have a sensitive nose and have not noticed any bad odors (I read that in some reviews) and it is a little thick, so it's harder to spread - but isn't that what you want from a sunscreen?
customer_reviews.author: CanBMckin

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, smells great
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this sun screen because of it's safe ratings. After we got it I fell in love with the smell, it doesn't smell like sunscreen.. it has a little bit of a fruit/coconut smell. I was also concerned about how well it would work but this is the only sun screen that I used on my 2 year old on our 11 day trip in Florida. We went to siesta key and Disney world in July. It was so hot and the sun was at a level 7-10 every day. She didn't get any sunburns while we were there.
customer_reviews.author: American Veteran Seller

customer_reviews.title: Mineral based
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for my son since he was a baby (he's now 4yo). I like that it is mineral-based so I don't have to worry about chemical absorption into his baby skin. That also means it can be a little hard to spread and blend in, but that's too be expected. The sunscreen dispenses easily, and the tube is a good size - not too big and not too small.
customer_reviews.author: RKU

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: First time my kids got bad sunburns. It smells great but it is definitely not 50 spf. I had better luck using Honest sunscreen in the past. During our vacation I had to switch and borrow my cousin's Target brand sunscreen because her son didn't have any sunburns and mine looked liked lobsters. Very disappointed as I bought 3 tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Bunting

customer_reviews.title: I have sensitive skin and this worked great
customer_reviews.text: I have crazy sensitive skin and had no problem or breakouts with this. The scent was light and pleasant. It is thick and takes a bit to rub it in but it's worth it. I'm not a huge fan of sunscreen but know I have to wear it, this is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best sunscreen ever made, no kidding!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is absolutely amazing. I have bought several tubes now of this sunscreen. At first, I bought it specifically for our youngest when she was a baby. Now we all use it though! My youngest has been in the sun for hours with her fair skin and has never had even as much as a hint of a sunburn. It smells nice, isn't too greasy and works better than anything I've ever seen. I grew up in Arizona and am a redhead. Trust me, you need this!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy77

customer_reviews.title: The best for kids!
customer_reviews.text: This is our favorite kid friendly sun screen. We use it for all of us, not just the kids. We have never gotten a sun burn while using it. And it’s very easy to spread and doesn’t have an unpleasant texture like so many others do. Simply the best sunscreen!
customer_reviews.author: Janey

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product!!! My 15 month old got severely burned after lathering him in this continually!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Reapplied as directed, burned anyway.
customer_reviews.text: My son has very sensitive skin and breaks out with chemical based sunscreens. We switched to Think Baby from Babyganics after some concerns about ingredients. While it didn't break him out, he burned right through the SPF 50+. We followed the instructions and reapplied as directed and he still burned.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny C.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with Upcoming Expiration Date
customer_reviews.text: I just order and received this product and am extremely disappointed to see it expires soon! I tried to return and it’s not eligible for return. Other buyers should be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Great sunscreen!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff was great for my 3 month old. We live in Florida, so just going out for a couple of hours requires sunscreen. This brand was recommended by my pediatrician for sensitive skin. I have used it on all of his body, including his face, and have not had any adverse reaction. I have been able to go out for long walks during the Florida summer and have never dealt with any kind of sun damage.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to spread
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd tube, I like the way it spreads so easily and doesn’t leave too much residue with application. I have tried 5+ different brand and decided tbis is what I’ll be using for my son. I also have the stick that I carry when I’m out.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Great sunblock
customer_reviews.text: Love the light, citrusy fragrance. Goes on thick so you can feel like it's going to work on your baby but after 15 minutes it doesn't stay white and the skin feels smooth and not greasy. I feel safe using this product. I've only used the Aveeno sunblock for babies but it was really greasy on my baby's face and the fragrance reminded me of an old woman....so...back to think baby!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: Seemed to work great
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my baby when he was 3 months old -- a little younger than the pediatrician recommended but we were headed to the beach and I thought the alternative of him burning was worse than not using sunscreen at all. I tested a little on his legs a week leading up to the beach with no negative reaction. Sunscreen seemed to work great on his face and elseware in high levels of sun and I was happy knowing the ingredients were safe for him as well.
customer_reviews.author: Katie R.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: I heard so many good things about this sunscreen so I was excited to ...
customer_reviews.text: I heard so many good things about this sunscreen so I was excited to try it. We used it on the 2 year old at the beach and it was just as good as I had heard. We used a generous amount on the 2yo and he didn't even get red in the hot sun all day! My new favorite sunscreen!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smells amazing
customer_reviews.text: I can’t get over how good this sunscreen smells! And so far, it’s effective! Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H

customer_reviews.title: Use Bug Spray at Beach with this product
customer_reviews.text: I love the orange sickle smell but DO NOT wear this at the beach without bug spray. We attracted a plague of flies. I never screamed so much in my life. Just imagine yourself looking stupid while others laugh and are thankful they are not you. I'm sure I'm on someone's Facebook feed.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Love!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because the active ingredient is zinc oxide and is non-nano. However, I'm keeping it because is awesome! It is very easy to apply because is not super thick and runs nicely through the skin which is especially important when you have to do it quickly or the kids will run away :) The smell is great! It smells like fruit. I will continue to use this with my baby and 6 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Safe sunscreen without the residue!
customer_reviews.text: Goes on smooth and doesn’t leave that awful mineral white residue that some other natural safe sunscreens do. Also has a nice light scent that reminds me of summer! We use it on our son that is just over a year old, he has sensitive fair skin and hasn’t had any issues with this sunscreen. Will continue to purchase this brand.
customer_reviews.author: katy petzak

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: The lotion is a bit thick and you have to really rub it in, but it kept my baby burnt free from the Cali sun and that’s what is most important! I would recommend getting a separate face stick sunscreen and not use this on the face. Overall, this product works great!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Rated safest physical sunscreen for your baby by many consumer health lists. Does not go on too thickly or leave white streaks. I use it on myself, my toddler, and husband too. Has a lovely scent. We've never been sunburnt with it on. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Need to use a lot of it for strong sun
customer_reviews.text: Sun protection is only moderate in strong sun, so you'll need to slather a ton of this on yourself if you burn easily and go to the beach in the Caribbean or farther south. But nice to know it's non-nano and all natural. No other all natural, non-nano sunscreen is this effective, so I'll still be buying these.
customer_reviews.author: Jane L.

customer_reviews.title: Nongreasy Sunscreen
customer_reviews.text: I like that this sunscreen was not as greasy as some others we tried before. It also seems to rub into the skin better than other brands, which means my kid gets to start playing in the water faster! I also rub the sunscreen in my hands/palms first before rubbing it on my son, which I think helps with not having to rub it in so much for it to absorb into the skin.
customer_reviews.author: familyof3

customer_reviews.title: Best sunscreen for my super pale son!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great, my son is SUPER pale (just like his mom 😂) so we use lots of sunscreen and he has never burned while wearing this. It spreads well (does leave a white coat at first but it absorbs quickly and goes away).
customer_reviews.author: Alenfishman

customer_reviews.title: No Sunburns & Smells Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: We used this sunscreen all of summer 2017 on our 1 year old. In addition to the sunscreen, we always have a hat on her and when possible we use UPF clothing. She has never gotten burnt yet. We are diligent about applying frequently which is a must with any sunscreen. The only issue was sometimes we’d have trouble rubbing it all in which would result in a white residue. This is to be expected with any Zinc sunscreens. We love the fact that we have this alternative to the chemical filled sunscreens. It also smells wonderful (somewhat citrusy).
customer_reviews.author: Elmo247

customer_reviews.title: More natural and safe sunscreen for the family
customer_reviews.text: A bit expensive, but feel safe to apply on my kids who have sensitive skin. Although there are higher scored sunscreen in the EWG site, I purchase it based on the it being one of the best among SPF50+, and without coconut or cocoa oil (kids slightly allergic to). Due to the Zinc oxide, you will expect the whitish paste, but overall very smooth and easy to apply and blend. Thinkbaby, thinkkids and thinksport etc seem to have the same ingredient. I choose this to use for myself because a lot more review for this one indicating more people buy this so batches may be fresher.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: EWG score of 1.  LOVE this super safe sunscreen for my kids.
customer_reviews.text: After doing a lot of research I found “thinkbaby” sunscreen for my babies. This product can’t be beat with an EWG score of 1. Not too thick, smells nice, and best of all it’s SAFE. As a life rule, and especially with kids, it’s important to know what you’re putting on and in the body. Bravo thinkbaby!!! Excited to try the “thinksport” everyday face tinted sunscreen for adults!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Thinkbaby Safe Sunscreen SPF 50+ (3 ounce)
product_meta.description: Size:1 Unit (3 Ounce)All of our Thinkbaby body care all-stars in a convenient set. Includes our award-winning 50+ SPF Safe Sunscreen, and our Shampoo & Body Wash, Baby Lotion, and Bubble Bath. Each body care item is a full 8 ounces with a convenient pump, while the sunscreen is our full 3 ounce tube (big enough for many uses, small enough to fly with). We specially formulated our body care with the same kind of thought that went into our BPA-free baby feeding line - safe ingredients, BPA-free packaging, and no animal testing.
feature_bullets: First sunscreen to pass Whole Foods Premium Care requirements and top-rated by EWG since creation in 2010 with a “1” rating. Recipient of more awards than any other sun care line.
Free of biologically harmful chemicals like avobenzone, oxybenzone, paraben, phthalates, PABA, 1,4 dioxane, and UV chemical absorbers.
Highly effective with an SPF at 50+. Highest level of water resistance per the FDA (80-minute water resistance) and broad-spectrum coverage for UVA and UVB.
Reef Friendly: Free of known reef damaging chemicals and achieves the highest level of biodegradability Non-nano zinc oxide formulation, non-aerosol formulation
Applies and absorbs easily without the oily feeling or obtrusive smell of traditional sunscreens. Cruelty Free (Leaping Bunny) certified, Gluten free & Vegan
